refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: mdaq_ao_write(channels, range, data); mdaq_ao_write(linkID, channels, range, data);

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function sets MicroDAQ analog outputs. The channels argument can be a scalar or vector and it should contain channels numbers according to MicroDAQ hardware configuration. The range argument specifies channel measurement input range. Scalar or vector (if applicable for MicroDAQ hardware configuration) can be provided. If scalar provided, its value will be used for all used channels. In order to obtain supported ranges by device mdaq_ao_scan_init() function shall be called without arguments.

listitem.para: channels: Single channel or array of channels numbers to read
range: Analog output range, integer number according to MDAQ device version - check usage description.
data : Array or single voltage Analog Output (AO) value

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: // write 2, 4, 6 , 8 AI channel with 1, 2, 3, 4 voltage value mdaq_ao_write([2, 4, 6, 8], 1, [1, 2, 3, 4]);
refsection.para: Calling function with link_id for better performance
